headline.main: Sales Growth at McDonald's Is the Highest in 17 Years

docs.abstract: McDonald's suffers legal setback this week with reinstatement of obesity lawsuit, but financially company is doing well; reports that worldwide growth at restaurants open at least 13 months, or same-store sales, was at its highest in 17 year; same-store sales grew 5.1 percent in quarter; both fourth-quarter and 2004 profits are sharply up; quarterly earnings more than triple, to $398 million, for quarter ending Dec 31; for year, company has net income of $2.28 billion, or $1.79 a share (S
docs.lead_paragraph: McDonald's suffered a legal setback this week with the reinstatement of an obesity lawsuit, but financially the company is doing well. Yesterday, McDonald's reported that worldwide growth at restaurants open at least 13 months, or same-store sales, was at its highest level in 17 years. Same-store sales grew 5.1 percent in the quarter.
docs.snippet: McDonald's suffered a legal setback this week with the reinstatement of an obesity lawsuit, but financially the company is doing well.

headline.main: Uncle Sam's Diet: Try It, You Might Like It

docs.abstract: Dr Joshua Kolko letter responds to William Grimes Jan 23 article; holds that he was dismayed by Grimes's conclusion that because Uncle Sam diet was so unlike that on which most Americans were raised, its goals were futile; drawing
